definition: subprime lending/abbr. for 次級貸款|次级贷款[ci4 ji2 dai4 kuan3]
next in sequence/second/the second (day, time etc)/secondary/vice-/sub-/infra-/inferior quality/substandard/order/sequence/hypo- (chemistry)/classifier for enumerated events: time
to lend on interest/to borrow/a loan/leniency/to make excuses/to pardon/to forgive
subprime mortgage crisis/abbr. for 次級房屋信貸危機|次级房屋信贷危机[ci4 ji2 fang2 wu1 xin4 dai4 wei1 ji1]

sentences.english: No one mentions the dreaded word sub - prime over cocktails at Centro or "M on the Bund".
sentences.chinese: 没人在酒廊和餐厅的酒会上提起次贷这个可怕的词。

sentences.english: The fifth chapter analyzes the revelation of the subprime crisis to financial supervision in China.
sentences.chinese: 第五章分析次贷危机对我国金融监管的启示。

sentences.english: It's especially true right now with the subprime crisis.
sentences.chinese: 在次贷危机下，情况更是如此。

sentences.english: Perhaps he can solve the mortgage crisis and the weak dollar, too.
sentences.chinese: 也许他能解决次贷危机，顺便拯救虚弱的美元。

sentences.english: French bank, BNP Paribas, announced big losses on subprime-mortgage investments.
sentences.chinese: 法国巴黎银行宣布其在次贷投资商损失惨重。

sentences.english: Fourth, the United States sub-loan crisis of our MBS to carry out a wake-up call.
sentences.chinese: 美国次贷危机为我们开展MBS敲响了警钟。

definition: subprime lending/abbr. to 次貸|次贷
subprime mortgage

credit crisis/see also 次貸危機|次贷危机[ci4 dai4 wei1 ji1]
credit/borrowed money
financial crisis
Lehman Brothers, investment bank
a loan/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/to provide a loan (e.g. bank)/to raise a loan (from e.g. a bank)
Freddie Mac, US mortgage company/formerly Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corp.
bad debt
financial leverage/leveraging (i.e. buying shares on borrowed funds)
to reduce interest rates
consumer finance/abbr. of 消費金融|消费金融[xiao1 fei4 jin1 rong2]
economic crisis
the Great Depression (1929-c. 1939)
to borrow or lend money/debit and credit items on a balance sheet
